metadata.Title: CVE-2023-5367 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A out-of-bounds write flaw was found in the xorg-x11-server. This issue occurs due to an incorrect calculation of a buffer offset when copying data stored in the heap in the XIChangeDeviceProperty function in Xi/xiproperty.c and in RRChangeOutputProperty function in randr/rrproperty.c, allowing for possible escalation of privileges or denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5367` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xnest - 2:21.1.7-1ubuntu3.1
xorg-server-source - 2:21.1.7-1ubuntu3.1
xserver-common - 2:21.1.7-1ubuntu3.1
xserver-xephyr - 2:21.1.7-1ubuntu3.1
xserver-xorg-core - 2:21.1.7-1ubuntu3.1
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:21.1.7-1ubuntu3.1
xvfb - 2:21.1.7-1ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

xwayland - 2:22.1.8-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Jan-Niklas Sohn working with Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative

notes.Note: mdeslaur> xorg server is actually the xorg-server package the xorg package only contains docs xwayland package contains parts of xorg-server

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:21.1.7-1ubuntu3.1').
xwayland package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:22.1.8-1ubuntu1.1').
